MediaKeyStatusMap.summary: The MediaKeyStatusMap interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API is a read-only map of media key statuses by key IDs.

MediaKeyStatusMapEntries.summary:
The entries() method
of the interface returns a new Iterator object,
containing an array of [key, value] pairs for each element in the status map, in
insertion order.
MediaKeyStatusMapEntries.returns: A new Iterator object. Each element in the Iterator is an array containing a key and a value.

MediaKeyStatusMapForEach.summary:
The forEach() method of the
interface calls callback once for each key-value pair
in the status map, in insertion order. If an argument is present it will be passed to
the callback.

MediaKeyStatusMapGet.summary: The get() method of the interface returns the status value associated with the given key, or undefined if there is none.

remarks.para: The status value indicates whether or not the specific key can be used for decryption.

MediaKeyStatusMapGet.returns: A string specifying the status value associated with the given key, or undefined.The following status values are allowed:

MediaKeyStatusMapHas.summary:
The has() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref('Boolean')}}, asserting
whether a value has been associated with the given key.

MediaKeyStatusMapKeys.summary:
The keys() method of the
interface returns a new Iterator object, containing
keys for each element in the status map, in insertion order.

MediaKeyStatusMapSize.summary:
The size read-only property of
the interface returns the number of key/value paIrs
in the status map.

MediaKeyStatusMapValues.summary:
The values() method of the
interface returns a new Iterator object, containing
values for each element in the status map, in insertion order.
